title: Jhonnes
text:
Jhonnes Marques de Souza (born 22 April 1984) is a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> defender who last played for <a href="FC%20ViOn%20Zlat%C3%A9%20Moravce">ViOn Zlaté Moravce</a> in the <a href="Slovak%20First%20Football%20League">Fortuna Liga</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Londrina">Londrina</a>, Paraná, Jhonnes was signed by <a href="Junior%20Team%20Futebol">Londrina Junior Team</a> in 2004, the youth team of <a href="Londrina%20Esporte%20Clube">Londrina</a> (later became two separate entity). He also trailed at <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> team <a href="Udinese%20Calcio">Udinese</a> but failed to sign a contract, as Italian clubs were restricted to sign any non-EU player.
Slovenia.
In September 2004 he left for Slovenian side <a href="NK%20Dom%C5%BEale">Domžale</a> along with <a href="Wilson%20Aparecido%20Xavier%20J%C3%BAnior">Juninho</a>. In February 2005, his contract with <a href="Junior%20Team%20Futebol">Londrina Junior Team</a> was extended to 31 December 2008 and <a href="Jefferson%20Lucas%20Azevedo%20dos%20Santos">Lucas</a> also joined him at <a href="Dom%C5%BEale">Domžale</a>. He played 20 league matches in 2005–06 season. In 2006–07 season he left for <a href="NK%20Celje">Celje</a>. In January 2007, his contract with <a href="Junior%20Team%20Futebol">Londrina Junior Team</a> was extended again, to 31 December 2011.
Returned to Brazil.
In January 2008. he joined <a href="Clube%20N%C3%A1utico%20Capibaribe">Náutico</a>. and in February left for <a href="Treze%20Futebol%20Clube">Treze</a>. He also trailed at German side <a href="TuS%20Koblenz">TuS Koblenz</a> in January 2009, played a friendly.
In February 2009, he was signed by <a href="Londrina%20Esporte%20Clube">Londrina</a>. In April, he was signed by <a href="Arapongas%20Esporte%20Clube">Arapongas</a>.
Return to Europe.
He was loaned to Croatian side <a href="NK%20Hrvatski%20dragovoljac">Hrvatski dragovoljac</a> in August 2009.
In August 2010, he finally terminated his contract with <a href="Junior%20Team%20Futebol">Junior Team Futebol</a> (ex-Londrina Junior Team) and left for Latvia side <a href="FK%20Liep%C4%81jas%20Metalurgs">Liepājas Metalurgs</a>, played 8 times and scored 2 goals in <a href="Latvian%20Higher%20League">Latvian Higher League</a>.
In February 2011, he signed a contract with <a href="%C3%9Ajpest%20FC">Újpest FC</a>. and in September 2011 he signed for <a href="NK%20Vara%C5%BEdin%20%281931%E2%80%932015%29">NK Varaždin</a>.
